## SDQ vs BFI

If you find yourself frequently dealing with psychological questionnaires like the Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ) and Big Five Inventory (BFI), you may recognise the challenges of comparing them. This process, known as harmonisation, can often be a lengthy, complex task. Welcome to the solution called Harmony. This powerful tool was purpose-built for psychologists and social scientists aiming to streamline the SDQ vs BFI comparison and other similar tasks. Harmony employs advanced AI and natural language processing to match items within questionnaires, even when dealing with multiple languages. When it comes to SDQ vs BFI, it's simple. You can select these instruments from Harmony's extensive database or upload your own versions via the user-friendly web interface. Harmony will then generate a percentage match for each item, saving you valuable research time and ensuring the harmonisation is as objective and accurate as possible. In the age of data science and tech-assisted research, there's no need to muddle through extensive PDFs manually. Let Harmony simplify the comparison of SDQ vs BFI and watch your efficiency increase. By leveraging such powerful tools in your research, you're free to focus on what really matters: extracting valuable insights from the data. So, consider adding Harmony to your toolkit. Think of how much easier the task of SDQ vs BFI comparison would be.

## Compare the items in SDQ and BFI

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import SDQ and BFI into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SDQ into Harmony</a> - compare SDQ with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just BFI into Harmony</a> - compare BFI with other instruments
